name: Trigeminovascular Dysautonomia
chief_complaint: I have excruciating facial pain that comes in waves, like electric shocks, and sometimes my eye turns red and tears uncontrollably

lab_results.3T MRI Brain: neurovascular conflict at root entry zone

prognosis: Guarded - 60% achieve significant pain reduction with combined surgical and medical therapy, but recurrence rates approach 30% at 5 years
description: A rare neurovascular disorder characterized by paroxysmal facial pain with prominent autonomic features, resulting from pathological interactions between trigeminal afferents and cranial parasympathetic outflow. Distinct from classical trigeminal neuralgia by its autonomic component and from cluster headache by its shorter attack duration and triggerability.
